title: French minister: no-deal Brexit likely if Britain does not seek compromise
text:
FILE PHOTO: Amelie de Montchalin, newly-appointed French Junior Minister for European affairs, leaves the Elysee Palace following the weekly cabinet meeting in Paris

(Reuters) - A no-deal Brexit is likely if Britain does not seek compromise, French State Secretary for European Affairs Amelie de Montchalin said on Friday.

Asked whether it was increasingly likely that Britain was heading for a no-deal Brexit, de Montchalin said on France Inter radio: "It is likely".

"At this point, if talks do not proceed the way we hope they will, if there is no desire, particularly from the British side, for compromise, then a no-deal (Brexit) is possible," she added.





(Reporting by Benoit van Overstraeten; Writing by Geert De Clercq; Editing by Shri Navaratnam)
